page.title: 08 Jonathan Catherall
page.content: An important figure in local history, connected with industry and religion is Jonathan Catherall. His father died in 1777 while he was in London studying law.Martha, his mother called him back to help run the family brick making business and they became partners.Jonathan, one of 4 children lived in what is now known as the Hope and Anchor pub which is by the Trap.The Trap is an old clayhole but is now full of water.In 1792 Jonathan married Catherine Jones and in 1800 he finished building their new home.Jonathan called it Hawkesbury House.In 1811 Jonathan bought a piece of land and built the first non-conformist church is Buckley.Today it is called St.John's United Reformed Church.Jonathan's tombstone is in the graveyard.
